title: The Black Dwarf
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: And it was a lucky chance, he said, that on thatvery day they had got notice that Westburnflat did not intend tokeep his tryste at Castleton, but to hold them at defiance; so that aconsiderable party had assembled at the Heugh-foot, with the intentionof paying a visit to the robber's tower on the ensuing morning, andtheir course was easily directed to Ellieslaw Castle.

title: The Black Dwarf
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: He's a clever fallow, indeed!maun kilt awa wi' ae bonny lass in the morning, and another at night,less wadna serve him! but if he disna kilt himsell out o' the country,I'se kilt him wi' a tow, for the Castleton meeting's clean blawn ower;his friends will no countenance him."

title: The Black Dwarf
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "Our neighbours hae taen a day at the Castleton to gree wi' him at thesight o' men," said Hobbie, mournfully; "they behoved to have it a'their ain gate, or there was nae help to be got at their hands."

title: The Black Dwarf
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Bide till the meeting at Castleton,as ye hae greed; and if he disna make ye amends, then we'll hae it outo' his heart's blood.

title: The Black Dwarf
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But I'll see what o'them can be gotten back, and I'll take this day twa days to meet Hobbieat the Castleton wi' twa friends on ilka side, and see to make anagreement about a' the wrang he can wyte me wi'."

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: May 7, Friday.— Came thirty six miles over the moors, through Castleton, saw Peak Hole, a most stupendous cavern, thence through Hope a small market town and over ^Nlilstone Edge, a prodigious high hill, and thence a bad road to Sheffield, where Lady Oxford was so good as to present us with some coal ware.

title: The novels and tales of Robert Louis Stevenson.

title: The works of Robert Louis Stevenson;
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Treasure Island, the finest tale of maritime adventure that has been told since Defoe produced his great romance, was begun at Castleton of Braemar in the summer of 1881, with the object of relieving the tedium of a schoolboy — prompted by the rough sketch of an island-map — and was finished the following winter among the pinewoods of Davos, Some months previously.

title: Rambles in Europe ... With historical facts relating to Scotch-American families, gathered in Scotland and the North of Ireland ... Illustrated

title: Rambles in Europe ... With historical facts relating to Scotch-American families, gathered in Scotland and the North of Ireland ... Illustrated

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: It chanced that Sir Andrew Eviot, hearing inCastleton that he was in pursuit of a limmer orBorder thief, had ridden up the water to join him.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires

snippet: But there will not be a whisper of our cominguntil we are at Castleton."

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires

snippet: IVe noacquaintance with it, but I aye fancied it led toCastleton."

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires

snippet: He is watchedhome every night, and when he hath been housedto-night, news will be brought to the brig at Castleton.
